intro: Campanula plicatula, commonly known as the pleated bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive pleated, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Campanula plicatula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
